57  void KSIntCalculatorArgonExcitation::InitializeComponent()
58  {
59  // Use SetExcitationState to change fExcitationState
60  if( fExcitationState > 0 )
61  {
62  // Build file name for excitation state
63  std::stringstream fileName;
64  fileName << "argon_excitation_state-" << this->fExcitationState << "_cross-section.txt";
65 
66  // Set file name
67  fDataFile = fileName.str();
68 
69  // Read file and create supporting points
70  ComputeSupportingPoints( 0 );
71  }
72  }

74  void KSIntCalculatorArgonExcitation::SetExcitationState( unsigned int aState )
75  {
76  fExcitationState = aState;
77  }
78 
79  void KSIntCalculatorArgonExcitation::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& )
80  {
81  double tInitialKineticEnergy = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
82  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
83 
84  // outgoing primary
85 
86  // tLostKineticEnergy is equal to the threshold energy, which currently is the first
87  // element in the data map.
88  double tLostKineticEnergy = fSupportingPoints->begin()->first;
89  double tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
90  // ToDo: tTheta?
91  double tTheta = 0;
92 
93  //todo:://here now some fancy formulas from ferencs EH2scat
94 
95  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
96  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
97  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
98 
99  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
100  aFinalParticle.SetTime( anInitialParticle.GetTime() );
101  aFinalParticle.SetPosition( anInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
102  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
103  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tInitialKineticEnergy - tLostKineticEnergy );
104  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( GetName() );
105 
106  return;
107  }

142  void KSIntCalculatorArgonElastic::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& )
143  {
144  double tInitialKineticEnergy = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
145  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
146 
147  // outgoing primary
148 
149  double tLostKineticEnergy = 0;
150  double tTheta = 0;
151  double tPhi;
152 
153  //todo:://here now some fancy formulas from ferencs EH2scat
154 
155  tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
156 
157  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
158  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
159  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
160 
161  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
162  aFinalParticle.SetTime( anInitialParticle.GetTime() );
163  aFinalParticle.SetPosition( anInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
164  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
165  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tInitialKineticEnergy - tLostKineticEnergy );
166  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( GetName() );
167 
168  return;
169  }

190 
191  double KSIntCalculatorArgon::GetInterpolation( const double &anEnergy, std::map< double, double >::iterator &point ) const
192  {
193  std::map< double, double >::iterator firstPoint = point;
194  --firstPoint;
195 
196  double slope = (point->second - firstPoint->second) / (point->first - firstPoint->first);
197  double y0 = firstPoint->second - slope * firstPoint->first;
198 
199  return slope * anEnergy + y0;
200  }
201 
202  double KSIntCalculatorArgon::GetUpperExtrapolation( const double &anEnergy, std::map< double, double >::iterator & ) const
203  {
204  return fParameters->at( 0 ) * pow( anEnergy, fParameters->at( 1 ) );
205  }
206 
207  double KSIntCalculatorArgon::GetLowerExtrapolation( const double &, std::map< double, double >::iterator & ) const
208  {
209  return 0;
210  }
211 
212  double KSIntCalculatorArgon::GetCrossSectionAt( const double &anEnergy ) const
213  {
214  // Zero? Interpolation? Extrapolation? Make a decision and execute it...
215 
216  std::map< double, double >::iterator point = fSupportingPoints->lower_bound( anEnergy );
217 
218  if( point == fSupportingPoints->begin() )
219  {
220  // Lower extrapolation
221  return GetLowerExtrapolation( anEnergy, point );
222  }
223  else if( point == fSupportingPoints->end() )
224  {
225  // Upper extrapolation
226  return GetUpperExtrapolation( anEnergy, point );
227  }
228  else
229  {
230  // Linear interpolation
231  return GetInterpolation( anEnergy, point );
232  }
233  }
234 
235  void KSIntCalculatorArgon::ComputeSupportingPoints( unsigned int numOfParameters )
236  {
237  // Clear supporting points
238  fSupportingPoints->clear();
239 
240  // New read in
241  KTextFile* tInputFile = katrin::CreateDataTextFile( fDataFile );
242 
243  if( tInputFile->Open( katrin::KFile::eRead ) )
244  {
245  KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader reader( tInputFile->File(), numOfParameters );
246  if( !reader.Read() )
247  {
248  intmsg( eError ) << "KSIntCalculatorArgon::ComputeSupportingPoints " << ret;
249  intmsg( eError ) << " Error while reading < " << tInputFile->GetName() << " > " << eom;
250  }
251  else
252  {
253  // First, copy parameters for extrapolation:
254  fParameters->operator=( *reader.GetParameters() );
255 
256  if( reader.GetData()->size() > 0 )
257  {
258  // Copy data for interpolation.
259  // It is maybe better to calculate equidistant energy points to find the right
260  // interval earlier...
261  fSupportingPoints->operator=( *reader.GetData() );
262  }
263  else
264  {
265  intmsg( eError ) << "KSIntCalculatorArgon::ComputeSupportingPoints " << ret;
266  intmsg( eError ) << " No found data in < " << tInputFile->GetName() << " > " << eom;
267  }
268  }
269 
270  tInputFile->Close();
271  }
272  else
273  {
274  intmsg( eError ) << "KSIntCalculatorArgon::ComputeSupportingPoints " << ret;
275  intmsg( eError ) << " Cant open inputfile < " << tInputFile->GetName() << " > " << eom;
276  }
277  }
278

280  {
281  CalculateCrossSection( aParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV(), aCrossSection );
282  return;
283  }

285  void KSIntCalculatorArgon::CalculateCrossSection( const double anEnergy, double& aCrossSection )
286  {
287  aCrossSection = this->GetCrossSectionAt( anEnergy );
288  }

319  void KSIntCalculatorArgonSingleIonisation::InitializeComponent()
320  {
321  // numOfParameters: two for extrapolation power law plus one for the ionization energy.
322  ComputeSupportingPoints( 3 );
323 
324  // Get ionization energy:
325  fIonizationEnergy = fParameters->back();
326 
327  // Remove this energy from parameter list:
328  fParameters->pop_back();
329  }
330 
331  void KSIntCalculatorArgonSingleIonisation::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aSecondaries )
332  {
333  double tInitialKineticEnergy = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
334  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
335 
336  // outgoing primary
337  double tLostKineticEnergy = fIonizationEnergy + 0;
338  double tTheta = 0;
339  double tPhi;
340 
341  // ToDo: tLostKineticEnergy?
342 
343  //todo:://here now some fancy formulas from ferencs EH2scat
344 
345  // ToDo: tTheta?
346  tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
347 
348  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
349  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
350  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
351 
352  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
353  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
354  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tInitialKineticEnergy - tLostKineticEnergy );
355  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( GetName() );
356 
357  // Outgoing secondary
358  tTheta = acos( KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( -1., 1. ) );
359  tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
360 
361  tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
362  tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
363  tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
364 
365  KSParticle* tSecondary = KSParticleFactory::GetInstance().Create( 11 );
366  (*tSecondary) = anInitialParticle;
367  tSecondary->SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
368  tSecondary->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tLostKineticEnergy - fIonizationEnergy );
369  tSecondary->AddLabel( GetName() );
370 
371  aSecondaries.push_back( tSecondary );
372  }

404  void KSIntCalculatorArgonDoubleIonisation::InitializeComponent()
405  {
406  // numOfParameters: two for extrapolation power law plus two for the ionization energies.
407  ComputeSupportingPoints( 4 );
408 
409  // Get second ionization energy
410  (*fIonizationEnergy)[ 1 ] = fParameters->back();
411 
412  // Remove this one
413  this->fParameters->pop_back();
414 
415  // Get first ionization energy
416  (*fIonizationEnergy)[ 0 ] = fParameters->back();
417 
418  // Remove this one
419  fParameters->pop_back();
420  }
421 
422  void KSIntCalculatorArgonDoubleIonisation::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aSecondaries )
423  {
424  double tInitialKineticEnergy = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
425  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
426 
427  // outgoing primary
428  double tLostKineticEnergy = fIonizationEnergy->at( 0 ) + fIonizationEnergy->at( 1 ) + 0;
429  double tTheta = 0;
430  double tPhi;
431 
432  // ToDo: tLostKineticEnergy?
433 
434  //todo:://here now some fancy formulas from ferencs EH2scat
435 
436  // ToDo: tTheta?
437  tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
438 
439  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
440  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
441  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
442 
443  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
444  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
445  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tInitialKineticEnergy - tLostKineticEnergy );
446  aFinalParticle.AddLabel( GetName() );
447 
448  // Outgoing secondaries
449  for( int i = 0; i < 2; ++i )
450  {
451  tTheta = acos( KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( -1., 1. ) );
452  tPhi = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform( 0., 2. * KConst::Pi() );
453 
454  tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
455  tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
456  tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() * (sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit()) + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit());
457 
458  KSParticle* tSecondary = KSParticleFactory::GetInstance().Create( 11 );
459  (*tSecondary) = anInitialParticle;
460  tSecondary->SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
461  tSecondary->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tLostKineticEnergy - fIonizationEnergy->at( i ) );
462  tSecondary->AddLabel( GetName() );
463 
464  aSecondaries.push_back( tSecondary );
465  }
466  }

472  KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader::KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader( std::istream *aStream, unsigned int numOfParameters )
473  {
474  fStream = aStream;
475  fNumOfParameters = numOfParameters;
476  fData = new std::map< double, double >();
477  fParameters = new std::vector< double >();
478  }

483  delete fParameters;

486  std::vector< double >* KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader::GetParameters()
487  {
488  return fParameters;
489  }
490 
491  std::map< double, double >* KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader::GetData()
492  {
493  return fData;
494  }
495 
496  bool KSIntCalculatorArgonDataReader::Read()
497  {
498  if( !fStream->good() )
499  {
500  return false;
501  }
502 
503  enum Mode
504  {
505  READ_PARAMETER, READ_DATA
506  };
507 
508  Mode mode = fNumOfParameters > 0 ? READ_PARAMETER : READ_DATA;
509  int pos;
510  double value, secondValue;
511  bool secondValueReaded = false;
512  char c;
513  while( (*fStream) >> c )
514  {
515  // Skip comments
516  if( '#' == c )
517  {
518  fStream->ignore( std::numeric_limits< std::streamsize >::max(), '\n' );
519  }
520  else
521  {
522  pos = fStream->tellg();
523  fStream->seekg( pos - 1 );
524 
525  // Read number
526  (*fStream) >> value;
527 
528  switch( mode )
529  {
530  // The first fNumOfParameters numbers in file are parameters
531  // for extrapolation or something. After that it will read data
532  // points for interpolation.
533  case READ_PARAMETER :
534  fParameters->push_back( value );
535 
536  if( fParameters->size() >= fNumOfParameters )
537  {
538  mode = READ_DATA;
539  }
540  break;
541 
542  // Read data
543  case READ_DATA :
544  if( !secondValueReaded )
545  {
546  secondValue = value;
547  secondValueReaded = true;
548  }
549  else
550  {
551  // Now we have two values. "value" stands for the cross section
552  // and "secondValue" for the energy. Now we could store this data
553  // point into a map:
554  fData->insert( std::pair< double, double >( secondValue, value ) );
555  secondValueReaded = false;
556  }
557  break;
558  }
559  }
560  }
561 
562  if( secondValueReaded )
563  {
564  return false;
565  }
566 
567  return true;
568  }
569 
570 } /* namespace Kassiopeia */
